concept.title: Reports Menu
concept.shortdesc: An overview of the Reports menu in marketing reports and analytics.

ul.li: Access to the complete set of reports
Ability to set favorite reports for quick access

conbody.p: My Favorites, Frequently Viewed, and Report History are all report-suite specific. If you change report suites, all three lists will change.

Reports are navigated using a hierarchical column view. Click View All Reports, or press the Forward Slash key (/), and then press the Down Arrow key (?) to quickly display and navigate the menu using the Arrow keys. Press the Escape key to close the menu without changing the current report, or press Enter to load the selected report.
All reports, including bookmarks and dashboards, appear on this menu. For details on reports, see Report Descriptions.

continues to provide access to Admin tools, other components (such as Segment Builder and alerts), and other Analytics interfaces.

section.title: Search for Reports
section.p: The Reports menu provides an enhanced search experience. Click View All Reports , or press the Forward Slash key (/) , and then begin typing to quickly find a report:

Press the Tab key or the Down Arrow key (?) to navigate through the list of reports. Press the Escape key to close the search without changing the current report, or press Enter to load the selected report.

row.entry: Clicking this button expands or collapses the Reports menu so you can to view a report using the entire width of the browser window.
Clicking this icon expands the Marketing Cloud menu to allow you to change tools in Adobe Analytics, access the Admin Console, or manage your segments, bookmarks, or dashboards.

All of your report-suite-specific reports, dashboards, bookmarks, calculated metrics, and targets are contained in the View All Reports sections. Click here at any time to navigate through everything that is available to you.
Search Bar within View All Reports

entry.p: Lets you search for the resource you need. It uses so-called "fuzzy" search, so you don't need to enter the exact wording you are looking for. The search results are displayed in a straight list that you can navigate using up, down, and side arrows. Pressing Enter on a search result takes you directly to that report.

row.entry: You can open or close Analytics navigation at any time by clicking My Reports. By default, the navigation is open.
Brings up the segment rail that lets you apply segments to reports. You can also access the Segment Builder and Segment Manager interfaces from the segment rail.
Adobe Analytics lets you to mark reports as favorites that appear under My Favorites. You can define a separate set of favorites for each report suite.
Lets you download the report in PDF, CSV, Excel, and Word formats. (Advanced Download Options.)
Lets you email the report immediately or schedule the email on a one-time or recurring basis. Format options include PDF, CSV, Excel, HTML, Word, or Mobile (text only). (Advanced Delivery Options.)
Lets you perform the following actions: bookmark the report, add it to a dashboard, print it, add an alert to it, create a custom report, copy a graph, link to this report, and open a new window.

You can easily retrieve the reports you marked as Favorited from this area. On a per-user and per-report-suite basis, it shows ten Favorites and a More... link if you have more than ten favorites.
Note that you can rename reports but not dashboards in My Favorites.
Favorites are similar to bookmarks, but they are not stored in a folder or managed through the Bookmark Manager like bookmarks are.

Adobe Analytics keeps track of the ten reports you have run most often during the last 90 days and shows them here, sorted by how frequently you run them. If you have not been in this report suite for more than 90 days, it populates the list with a general list of ten popular reports.
Here, you find the most recent ten reports or dashboards that you have accessed in the last 90 days. You can easily find your way back to a previous step in your analysis or reporting.

section.title: Customizing the All Reports Menu
section.p: Administrators can change the reports contained within the Reports menu. See Menu Customizing in Admin Help.
